column4: I'm trying to setup a SSH server.  I can connect from within my home network but no one can connect from the outside.  I have port 22 forwarded to my server so that's not the problem.
if you can't connect from outside, but can inside, then the problem is with your firewall
but it's not.  I was running Mandrake and it worked. It stopped when I switched.
this is on the ip you'r irc'ing from?
no My server has a fixed IP 192.168.1.5 and I forward port 22 from my router switch.
if you're irc'ing from behind the same firewall as you're trying to configure, ssh is working fine; I can connect to your ssh daemon quite happily
no, my linksys router is connected to my cable modem.  I can find my IP if you want it.
I gave you some bad info.  I do have it forwarded to this computer right now.  My IP is 67.168.4.197
Am I?  I don't know.  Whatever installed with Ubuntu 5.04
anyway, ssh is working fine for you, I can ssh to your (presumably) internal machine
really?  A friend of mind can't... Maybe it's on his end.
I just discovered Ubuntu a few days ago.  It's REALLY stable.
Thanks Bob.  I'll get ahold of my friend and have him try again.
